reviewText: This DVD has a story which could be replayed in any major city around the world which has street crime in a poverty-stricken jurisdiction.  Nevertheless, thereal value of this DVD is the altruism of producer Antonio Capuano which resulted in groundbreaking international attention about neglected youth with nofuture in Italy, especially the poor of Naples. The producer illustrates all of this, in the true-to-life tragedy of a boy who is orphaned, and left with abusive relatives.  He roams the streets with a boy-and-girl gang of youths and joins in their drug abuse, prostitution and petty crimes.  Even worse, is a 12-year-old boy jailed by mistake with adult prisoners who rape and abuse him without mercy; then the boy is plagued by nightmares and bed-wetting.  After release, heand his other gang members are used sexually by adults, prostituted, and included in criminal activities with reckless abandon.  Why?  Italian youth under the age of 14 years old can not be arrested and jailed?!  In desperation, some of the gang members succumb to suicide or other self-destructive behaviors.  Theshocking reality of this DVD is enhanced by a cast of nonprofessional street boys and girls.  This is a film worthy of attention and viewing - more than once.
Title: N/A

reviewText: "Vito and the Others" show how families, schools, and social services fail the underclass children and teenagers of Naples, Italy.  Petty crime, television, arcade games, joyriding, sex, and getting a suntan are the key amusements when out of custody.  Prison life is rather more grim.  Regardless, there isn't much future.The distributor attached a short message to the wrapper plastic.  The message begins, "All Award Films International videos are available only in DVD-R format.  COA Movies does not manufacture the DVDs.  We only distribute them.  We want to earn your positive feedback and provide you with the best service. ..."The picture quality is moderate, like good VHS.  There are 21 chapter stops, but the chapter index shows only four, widely-spaced, ones.  The only other extra is contact information for Award Films International.  The film lasts 88 minutes and is in Italian with English subtitles.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love these kids.  They were all so rambunctious and full of playful energy.  Of course they were not good kids, and did get into plenty of trouble. It was a delightful film.

reviewText: In the opening of the movie Vito loses his family, and is placed into the custody of abusive relatives, who really don't care what Vito does, or where he goes. As a result, he gets into more and more trouble, with nobody making any effort to turn him around.

reviewText: This is a poorly done film. Vito was the only decent actor. But not much acting really required with the c grade script. Life as troublesome kids in Italy quite realistic but lapses in action and ridiculous dialog voids any realism. Alot is left to imagination as the flow of dialog is sketchy.
Title: N/A

reviewText: When I viewed the opening credits, I noticed that it was sponsored by the Italian Ministry of Tourism and Entertainment. That raised a flag in my mind that something was amiss.This film is about life among street children in Italy. It appeared that the Director was attempting to document life of these children in a gang. But it was so poorly done. There were several scenes that were repeated as if the Director was trying to fill in time. And I thought that nothing could be worse than Genesis Children.Don't waste your money on this movie. If you want to watch a decent film about gang life among children, purchase Pretty Boy.
Title: N/A
